title: Gnar Q sometimes turns back too early
body: By sometimes i mean 99% of the time. It's really annoying

replies.body: It turns back when it hits an enemy.

Why doesn't it say so in the tooltip?

And that means there is a bug where it doesn't return when hitting an opponent. I harass over minion waves with it all the time

"MINI GNAR - ACTIVE: Gnar throws his boomerang forward in a line, dealing physical damage and slowing all enemies hit for 2 seconds. **Upon striking an enemy** or reaching maximum range, **the boomerang will slowly come to an end**, travelling back towards Gnar in a fixed direction. Enemies beyond the first take only 50% damage and an enemy can only be damaged once."
Still why does it sometimes go over the entire minion wave until it reaches max range and then returns?

It doesn't turn back immediately. It's like a Draven ult where upon hitting an enemy it's momentum slows until it stops and then it makes it's way back. So if enemy units are close enough it will hit those beyond the initial unit hit as it slowly changes direction.

Not sure; at least, I've never noticed it happen to me. I'll often throw the boomerang into a group of minions if the enemy champion is standing right behind them for harass, because it will still go a bit farther in after hitting something. But I've never personally seen an instance where it'll go the full distance through a minion wave, unless the wave and the champion are close together and just far enough away that it seems like it's going the full distance, I'm not sure.

Actually, no. It turns back at the point you cast it to. So if it is supposed to turn back when it hits an enemy, then it isn't working. How it works right now is that you cast it, and it flies in the direction of your cast to the point your cursor was at. if that is less than full range, it won't fly full range. If you cast it past full range, it will make him walk out farther to throw it (I think). It most certainly does not return after hitting an enemy, and can hit as many enemies as you can fit between it and you before returning. Basically, if you tend to leave the mouse hovering just a little way away from your champ, you will usually under throw. You have to put the cursor at the max distance for it to go full range.

So I'm testing this in a game, and I'm really not sure what you're talking about.

Maybe you're just using different settings than me, but I'm still getting it as "Goes full distance unless it hits an enemy", no matter where my cursor is in relation to Gnar. At least, that's how it is as I am currently testing it.

This is how Gnar Q Functions.

* The boomerang always goes max range if it doesn't hit a target.
* The boomerang's return trajectory based on your speed and current direction.
* If the boomerang hits an enemy, it will travel slightly past the enemy while slowing down before going on the return trajectory. However this will not cause it to go past max range.
* Enemies can only be hit once by the boomerang
* The boomerang return trajectory is longer than the initial throw trajectory, and it slowly gains speed while returning.
* Catching the boomerang reduces it's cooldown.
* Mega-Gnar can catch the boomerang

Correct me if I'm wrong on any of these points. Not including numbers, just the mechanics of the skill.

i concur this is annoying and hard to understand.  Does it have a min range?  Sometimes i does go full range through a whole wave.  Clarity pls.  Does it even need to turn back at all, can we get it full range all the time?
